topic.title: Creating and connecting to a MSSQL service

body.p: This document describes how to create a MSSQL 2012 or 2014 service, and connect to it using the Helion client's tunnel command.
body.note: This document will demonstrate how to create and connect to a MSSQL 2012 instance; the procedure for creating and connecting to a MSSQL 2014 service is the same.
body.p: This document contains the following sections:

section.title: Create a MSSQL service instance
section.p: To create a MSSQL service instance, use the Helion ALS Client. To create a service instance, first connect the Helion ALS client to your Helion OpenStack or Helion Public Cloud instance using helion login and helion target.

section.p: Once the service instance is created, in order to connect to the instance, you must first deploy a tunneling application using the helion tunnel command.
